<!-- Generated by .automation/build.py, please do not update manually -->
# git_pathchk

Git files non-portable pathname check

## git_pathchk documentation

- Visit [Official Web Site](https://git-scm.com){target=_blank}

[![git - GitHub](https://gh-card.dev/repos/git/git.svg?fullname=)](https://github.com/git/git){target=_blank}

## Configuration in Mega-Linter

- Enable git_pathchk by adding `GIT_GIT_PATHCHK` in [ENABLE_LINTERS variable](https://nvuillam.github.io/mega-linter/configuration/#activation-and-deactivation)
- Disable git_pathchk by adding `GIT_GIT_PATHCHK` in [DISABLE_LINTERS variable](https://nvuillam.github.io/mega-linter/configuration/#activation-and-deactivation)

| Variable                                    | Description                                                                                                                                                                                  | Default value      |
|---------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------|
| GIT_GIT_PATHCHK_ARGUMENTS                   | User custom arguments to add in linter CLI call<br/>Ex: `-s --foo "bar"`                                                                                                                     |                    |
| GIT_GIT_PATHCHK_FILTER_REGEX_INCLUDE        | Custom regex including filter<br/>Ex: `(src|lib)`                                                                                                                                            | Include every file |
| GIT_GIT_PATHCHK_FILTER_REGEX_EXCLUDE        | Custom regex excluding filter<br/>Ex: `(test|examples)`                                                                                                                                      | Exclude no file    |
| GIT_GIT_PATHCHK_FILE_EXTENSIONS             | Allowed file extensions. `"*"` matches any extension, `""` matches empty extension. Empty list excludes all files<br/>Ex: `[".py", ""]`                                                      | Exclude every file |
| GIT_GIT_PATHCHK_FILE_NAMES_REGEX            | File name regex filters. Regular expression list for filtering files by their base names using regex full match. Empty list includes all files<br/>Ex: `["Dockerfile(-.+)?", "Jenkinsfile"]` | Include every file |
| GIT_GIT_PATHCHK_DISABLE_ERRORS              | Run linter but consider errors as warnings                                                                                                                                                   | `false`            |
| GIT_GIT_PATHCHK_DISABLE_ERRORS_IF_LESS_THAN | Maximum number of errors allowed                                                                                                                                                             | `0`                |

## Behind the scenes

### How are identified applicable files

- If this linter is active, all files will always be linted

<!-- markdownlint-disable -->
<!-- /* cSpell:disable */ -->

### Example calls

```shell
/bin/sh -c 'git ls-files -z | xargs -0 pathchk -P --'
```


### Installation on mega-linter Docker image


### Example success log

```shell
Results of git_pathchk linter (version 2.26.2)
See documentation on https://nvuillam.github.io/mega-linter/descriptors/git_git_pathchk/
-----------------------------------------------

[SUCCESS] .automation/test/git_pathchk/good


```
